intro: Didymoglossum lineare, commonly known as the narrow-leaved didymoglossum, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, temperate environments, often found in wet meadows or along stream banks. Didymoglossum lineare is an important component of certain wetland ecosystems, contributing to biodiversity and soil stabilization.
